subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 24 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Owen is given England B captaincy
Fit-again striker Michael Owen will captain England B when they take on Albania at Turf Moor on Friday.



 
Bale closes on Tottenham switch
Southampton defender Gareth Bale completes his medical at Spurs and is expected to sign within 24 hours.



 
Uefa blames Reds fans for chaos
Uefa blames Liverpool fans for the ticketing problems before Wednesday's Champions League final in Athens.








GOLF




PGA Championship leaderboard
All the latest from the European Tour's flagship event at Wentworth.



 
Broadhurst sets Wentworth target
Paul Broadhurst is the early clubhouse leader in the first round of the PGA Championship, two shots clear of Ernie Els.



 
Golf plans drug testing for 2008
The European Tour and other major international circuits intend to introduce anti-doping laws next year.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton unhurt in Monaco crash
Lewis Hamilton crashes in practice for the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Toseland - I can keep up momentum
James Toseland tells BBC Sport he is ready to kick on and win a second World Superbikes crown, starting this weekend at Silverstone.



 
Lauda 'stunned' by Hamilton start
Triple world champion Niki Lauda says Lewis Hamilton has impressed him more than any other rookie driver he has seen.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton unhurt in Monaco crash
Lewis Hamilton crashes in practice for the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Lauda 'stunned' by Hamilton start
Triple world champion Niki Lauda says Lewis Hamilton has impressed him more than any other rookie driver he has seen.



 
Raikkonen expects end to problems
Kimi Raikkonen hopes he has made a breakthrough in his struggles to adapt to his new Ferrari.








ATHLETICS




Kenyan trio to miss World Champs
World record holder Paul Tergat is one of three Kenyan marathon stars unavailable for August's World Championships in Osaka.



 
Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.



 
Sayers sets new UK javelin record
Goldie Sayers breaks the British javelin record with a throw of 65.05m at the Loughborough International meeting.








CYCLING




Zabel admits to doping at Telekom
German cyclist Erik Zabel becomes the latest cyclist to admit to using banned blood booster EPO while competing for Telekom in the 1990s.



 
Luca regains Giro d'Italia lead
Italy's Danilo di Luca wins the 12th stage of the Giro d'Italia to take the overall leader's pink jersey.



 
Landis hearing brought to an end
Floyd Landis's doping hearing ends on Wednesday after nine days of legal arguments and dramatic testimony.








FUN AND GAMES




Champions League Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the competition with our special quiz



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock



 
Victory is sweet for Pete
Pete Doherty scores the winner as his side win football event
